intro: Zilla myagroides var. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited zilla, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to coastal and sandy environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish to brownish flowers. Its fruit is a small, capsule-like structure containing numerous seeds. It is often found in coastal fynbos vegetation and is adapted to withstand salt spray and sandy soils.
